bibl.title: Catalogue of the Terracottas in the British Museum. Volume IV. Ptolemaic and Roman Terracottas from Egypt.
bibl.note: The Catalogue describes and illustrates some 800 terracottas. - Preface. - Introduction. - 1. Egyptian deities. - 2. Protective and fertility-promoting beings. - 3. Ritual, processions and festival. - 4. Votive figures (phallic). - 5. Ritual, votive and funerary objects. - 6. Greek deities and myth. - 7. Christian religion and myth. - 8. Coffin-attachments. - 9. Women, men and children: aspects of daily life. - 10. Objects of daily use. - 11. Animals and plants. - Concordances. Abbreviations and glossary. Bibliography and bibliographical abbreviations. Indexes.
BAILEY Donald M., Catalogue of the Terracottas in the British Museum. Volume IV. Ptolemaic and Roman Terracottas from Egypt.
London, British Museum Press, 2008, 4°, viii-228 pp. et 147 pll. ISBN 978-0-7141-2264-9. £120.
